评论概述: Unless you're an emaciated model, this is just a sweater.
评论详情: The material is EXTREMELY thin. Personally, I will not wear this without something on underneath it. To the point that one might consider wearing this "sweater" on a cool summer evening.  The sweater came vacuum sealed in 2 envelopes and smelled like a gas station straight out of the packaging.  The colors are not exactly the same as the Pic, but only the discerning eye might notice.  SIZE MATTERS. Unless you're a model with an eating disorder, you're getting a sweater. Not an "oversized sweater dress. "  Long story short, I don't believe it's worth $26+ shipping. This is a Shein/Temu item at best, therefore, should have cost less, too.
Super cute, decently warm. Definitely just a sweater tho. I'm 5'2" and this wasn't long on me at all. Oh well!

评论详情: It is lovely, but poor quality, and 3 weeks shipping time in US. Seems to be made for a younger, smaller teen or preteen instead of an adult. Absolutely not worth the full price.
This is made of the cheapest yarn possible. I’ve seen dollar tree costumes better made than this. I am sorely disappointed.
They advertise its plus size but it's not. Looks like a sweater on me. Not a dress. Returning

I love the look of it but it is very this. I’m worried about washing this maybe hand wash.

The arms of this thing are about nine inches too long, it isn’t shaped anything like the photos. It’s weird and boxy and just saggy and massive. Just not good.
Material is really thin and cheap. Looks and feels like something you'd find in a halloween costume. I'll be returning this.

评论概述: It fits how you'd expect if you're tall and plus sized
评论详情: 5'10, 200 lb, 40E.  I knew what I was getting into. It's super stretchy, with a very loose knit. It fits, but the oversized look isn't really there. Pretty tough to achieve that in my size, so it met my adjusted expectations.  The length falls about to the hip, chest and tummy fills it out, and the sleeves are slightly oversized, reaching about to where my thumb connects to my palm. The bottom kind of flares out, I imagine to follow the hip to thigh line on someone smaller. I've considered trying to stretch it and reshape it, but it's quite fragile.  I got the rainbow color, and It's definitely unique. Fun and colorful, but I've only worn it a couple times. Because it's not quite long enough, pairing it with leggings doesn't give the look I wanted, but wearing something full body (to elongate the upper to lower body and create a better base for a too-short sweater) might look better, such as a black slip dress or catsuit.  It is a bit scratchy, but didn't give me any major irritation. Still, you may want to wear something that can cover/protect your skin underneath if that's a concern.  Overall, I wouldn't buy it again because of the low wearability potential. If you are smaller, go for it. If you're closer to my size, you might be disappointed.

评论概述: Not a dress for me, but still cute!
评论详情: This is a cute sweater. Pretty warm too considering the rips and it's not lined. And the sleeves are long! I am 5'10", so that makes me happy. I'm knocking off a star because on me, it's not a dress. Maybe on a really petite person, but it's not stopping me on ordering another color.

The price is a bit too expensive for the quality. However, i dont regret my purchase because it fits well and it is comfortable. It needs to be styled in order to be flattering ajd it fits like a long sweater, not a dress. The color is true to the image. It survived my washer and dryer.

This is a surprisingly warm sweater for how many holes it has in it. I love how it hangs - you can wear fun leggings and a tank top under it with some leg warmers and just rock the entire punk look.

It's what I expected it to be. The yarn is 100% acrylic, so it doesn't shrink in a high heat dyer. I wear mine quite a bit since I first got it so it's a fairly decent option to Killstar's version. My only gripe is that it's a bit too much because the yarn is basically the same you'd find in a craft store. There's a big difference in terms of the knit and texture of that of the Killstar sweater.  But if you're looking for a basic accessory, it's pretty good, I just don't think the material and make is worth that much money. If you buy the Killstar sweater, it makes no difference.

Love the look of it, but because it’s only “one size” the picture is very deceiving. I wish it was actually as long as seen in the photo, that’s what I was hoping for. I’m a pretty small person, so I guessed maybe it would be but it didn’t go past my waist. Pretty, but not what I was promised.

I have this sweater in the white and also the baby pink stripes. It’s very cute and cozy. It catches on everything though!  I got hung up on a doorknob the other day. It washes well (I put it in a mesh lingerie bad to wash so it doesn’t catch on anything).

I absolutely LOVE this distressed look of this sweater! Because of the holes and loose stitch, I didn't expect it to keep me warm, but it is a bit warmer than a tee so there's that. I paired this with a pleated skirt and got lots of compliments all day on it! It's super cute, light weight, and has long enough sleeves which is a huge plus for me (I'm 6'1' so finding women's clothes that are long enough has always been a struggle). I am definitely looking at a few more of these in different colors to wear all through the fall and spring!
I’ve been looking for a sweater like this exactly for what felt like years. It’s so cute and cozy and surprisingly really warm for being more of an open knit.

Specially if you have to make a dollar stretch as far as possible like I do.  I'm 5'7 155 and it fits pretty loose just how I want it. The sweater is a regally length sweater and is very cheaply made.The color is pretty ,length in sleeves is great but you can tell after the first wash it will shred or shrink!For the price I paid it’s not worth it.

So, I should have read everything, and that's absolutely my fault, BUT after losing over 100lbs, I've been searching for new clothes, and I really liked how this sweater looked, so I bought it. Now, I'm still fat, but not as fat as I was, so it didn't fit as described, BUT it did fit, just more as a sweater than a sweater dress, and I'm actually very happy about that because it means my hard work has paid off that I can actually wear a "one size" piece of clothing. It's a little tight in the upper arms, but that's not the sweater's fault as my arms are still fat as well thanks to losing all the weight. All in all, it probably won't be a full "sweater dress", but it will be a very nice, comfy, and surprisingly warm and cooling sweater. I do recommend wearing a spaghetti strap shirt or other thin material tank top type shirt underneath the sweater.
It was okay it fit just right & was super warm. But it would be better if wasnt knitted and didnt have the ripped holes design. Because its not ripped jeans and just didnt work.
